comments.message: Was rather upset about the news that were reported by some media..obviously the facts wasn't clear enough.. i read that macdonalds are giving out 100 set of macdonald's nanoblock collectibles exclusively to the first 100 person that was at the queue at bugis.. was there at 3am and subsequently join in the queue around 6 plus.. and till 12 then i realized that it was only one nanoblock that was given away..i guess that i am not the only one who is expecting to reveive a full set of the nanoblocks..rather dissppointed that the media reporting the news does not have the full facts.. still hoping that at the end of collecting the orders we would be given a priviledge card or tickets for us to purchase the nanoblocks sets exclusively for the 100 people that put in much effort and showed great support for the campaign..but no.. it wasn't that exclusive though..below is the news that got me decived..
Hi McDonald's, appreciate if you can clarify if these nanoblocks come prefixed and glued. Which means we cannot fix them up ourselves?
Hi, so the mac house nano block wont be available tomorrow?
Tmr one is free treat and free nanoblock.. Then next week is the actual launch?
U guys are pretty dumb..its obviously just a launch..why would mcdonalds only release 100 sets when more money can be made? Was Hello Kitty released in 100 sets only, at one outlet?  -_-

Before you start to wonder on building the models...

These are just molded plastics and Hong Kong and Malaysia Mcds had them way before SG.
Only 100 pieces, too little. Might have to reconsider buying the rest since I can't get the full set.
This is worth skipping class for. By the way, how much will the whole set cost if I want to get it next week?
Maybe you should consider lucky draw since it is just 100 of them.. Singapore has millions of people!

Let me propose you a better marketing strategy:

Every purchase of Macdonalds Meal(whatever you want to promote) entitled you to a draw ticket, the more you buy, the more ticket you get. Maximum 3 tickets per person.

End of day, do your lucky draw to get out the 100 winners.

Fair chance for everyone, rather than basing on queuing.

I know Singaporeans like to Q and has alot of free time (it seems like you all does think this way) but this is not the way.
What are the treats applicable? & is it 1 set per pax or 1 piece?
So you are intending to ask adults who are interested in the toys to apply for leave and fight for a spot with the student who frequent there.
Hi yeah interested to know what treats are applicable as well.
Why is on a weekday lunch hour? I hope it can be like a preorder just like hello kitty then we collect the parcel at our own time.
Please provide for more outlets!  1 outlet really isn't enough! Give us the opportunity to buy online!

Seriously 100 sets? Might as well don't release. 
Make everyone fight to queue for it and piss everyone off for not able to get it.

I am a little confuse here. So it's a one day event and on the day itself, you will introduce all the nanoblocks? It come in per set or per item?First 100 customers need not pay and the subsequent customers have to pay? Each individual is entitle to how many sets? So if there are 5 nanoblocks and I have to buy 5 set meal? Wow, that's a lot of food..

Making people to queue again , and it is only 100 sets! 
This is crazy! Why don't you make it an open sale in every mcdonald?
Bangkok the best,  for the snoopy set.  I don't even have to eat n I get the whole set n got a discount too. Our McDonald's is so boring
HI there McDonald's Am I able to order online the whole set? Just like the previous hello kitty?
1day, 1store, 100items, 12pm,  Q since 5am... oh well, see you (expensive) McDonald's nanoblocks in Carousell then! :(
why is only applies to Bugis outlet only? and is only first 100 pax.. in malaysia mcdonald, doesn't applies this.. is sad...
Looks the hello kitty and the minions episodes have not taught McDonald's how ugly it can get when you limit orders to only 100 and only one store.
Anyone interested in 1 Mac house? $20 for 1, $18 for fast deal.
sounds like a preview promo (with a mad and mostly fruitless rush), followed by a main campaign where customers can get them for a small fee with a purchase, i reckon

10.post_text: Dear Valued Customers, we are performing scheduled system maintenance and upgrading works on our McDelivery system from 0400 hours to 0600 hours on 28th Jan 2016. Therefore, we are unable to accept McDelivery orders through our website or mobile app during this period. You may wish to contact us at our McDelivery hotline 6777 3777 to place your order. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience and bear with us in the meantime.

comments.message: Dear MacDonalds, your morning zombie ad is not only distasteful, but it's frightening. Imagine early in the morning, you switch on the TV to watch for news, weather, sipping your cup of coffee and tea over a newspaper. Suddenly, the sound of a zombie starts making eerie sounds. Disgusting! I have elderly and young children in my household, and this ad is playing constantly like a broken record, leaving us with a bad taste in the mouth. As parents, I am concerned. As a family member, I am even more concerned. As a customer of MacDonalds? .....I'm taking my business elsewhere. This is impossible. Please remove it; it doesn't go according to MDA regulations.

weird why town areas. you should try drive yr truck to industrial area like tuas or jurong island or even northern part of the island.
most of these pple who work in such places start as early as 7 am.
and they travel from one end of the island to another skipping their wonderful breaky.
WTF! To me it fuking horrible advertisement!!!. Whenever I see this stupid MacDonald advert on TV program I just curse it and switched channel to avoid it!!!.

The morning zombie TV Commercial is really distasteful. I refer to the advertising code issued by Media Development Authority, Singapore. Would the authority/ mc donalds please advise if the advert has breached the code?

10. Advertisements must be decent and tasteful in their content and
presentation, and should not cause offence to the community.

Children and Advertising
20. For the purpose of this Code, children are defined as those aged 14
years and below. The guidelines take into account the fact that children‟s
ability to distinguish between fact and fantasy will vary according to their age,
and that children in general tend to be imitative by nature.

b. Advertisements primarily targeted at children, or placed in
programmes likely to be seen by children, should not contain any
visuals, effects or words that might result in harm to them morally or
psychologically

Advertisements of TV Programmes, Movies and Arts/ Theatrical
Performances
25. a. Advertisements (including paid advertisements and in-house
trailers) of cinematic movies, telemovies, TV programmes and arts/
theatrical performances should not contain excessively violent scenes
such as close-up shots of infliction of injury and bloody wounds; gory
or horrifying scenes; and titillating or sexually exploitative scenes.
Vulgar language should also not be featured.

"nutty undertones of the hazelnut complements the crunchy bits from our cones"

its abit misleading in a way. it said crunchy bits. i assumed it would be the crunch frm hazel nut bits. Turns out its not. Now i read it again and i realize that its from their cones but honestly, its not crunchy at all. If anything i would describe them as crispy. Like, Kellogg's rice krispies cereal. 14.post_text: Dear Valued Customers, we are performing scheduled system maintenance and upgrading works on our McDelivery system from 0500 hours to 0600 hours on 21 Jan 2016. Therefore, we are unable to accept McDelivery orders through our website or mobile app during this period. You may wish to contact us at our McDelivery hotline 6777 3777 to place your order. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience and bear with us in the meantime.

comments.message: Disappointing product. Size equivalent to $2 FoF. Sure, the chicken was tender and the sauce was passable, but the mushrooms were almost nonexistent. What disgusted me the most, however, was the price. I paid $6.40 just for the burger, and a regular meal would have been more than $2 additional. Not worth it. Good try McD, but I'm not recommending this one.

21.post_text: Attention morning zombies! You don’t have to run on an empty stomach when you’re running late. Just grab our NEW bigger and heartier breakfast wraps and fuel up on the go. https://goo.gl/nVN9lt

comments.message: finally you realized that the current wrap is si pathetically small n not filling.
Just putting hash brown inside and it becomes all new 😅

Edited comment again: 

1. I ordered and requested the wrap without egg but they gave me the egg.

2. McDonald's received my complaint and have responded sincerely. I really appreciate it, thanks.

3. Branch Manager has called me personally and sincerely apologized. He will issue a meal on the house and I acknowledged the kind offer.

Errrm... The new wrap is terrible taste for me... Truly understand McDonald's trying their best to beat KFC breakfast wraps but unfortunately KFC breakfast is more better and the wrap is smotth unlike MCD the wrap is hard

Mcdonalds has simply lose it all.What set off as a $2 value set meal many yrs back has now change it slogon to "Grab & Go" to no slogon & no price tag in your lastest introduction of 2 new bf sets which cost a usual $4,$4.30.Now that Mcd has complicated things by adding more fanciful sets at a higher prices.What seen like a straightforward $2 set now has $3,$4,$4.30 sets among the choices so it makes no different just like ordering any other usual set meals.
anything for vegetarians apart from hotcakes, hashbrowns and corn in the morning, Only corn (and ice creams) in the evening!!! ?

Follow up:

Hey McDonald's, I reported the bad things so let me report the good things you did as well. I have received a call personally from the Branch Manager and he have sincerely apologized. I was told to go back to the restaurant and they will provide a replacement meal for me. 

I feel bad but I accepted their kind offer, the Branch Manager Marcus is very friendly and humble. He keep apologizing for it, (fyi I had seen many other bad attitude managers around) but he is willing to apologize despite of his designation. That is really remarkable and it's great you guys have staff like him. 

 I will visit often and try not to order food with egg. Thumbs up for your sincerity towards your customers. I am saying this because I want others to know the good work, keep it up.

GudMorning alls...Im enjoying eating my Breakfast Wrap Chicken Sausage & Orange juice just now at home...Its so full & niceeee...Happy with the taste & enought intake for my 1st meal of the day...TQSM McDonald...😘👍

Able to educate Clementi Mall's staffs that this is the Breakfast Wrap. Not sunshine roll.. I ordered a Breakfast Wrap with Coffee this morning and was told Wrap is only available in Afternoon and was given SUNSHINE ROLL~~!!  >_<

When I went to the outlet at the basement of Clifford centre, the same set only cost me 4.30. 

Can you pls clarify why is there a price difference?
